CatDescriptText: Evelyn Brooks, social worker, 107 W. 14th Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike? Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" Answer reads: "From all indications, I'm afraid that there will be a strike.  I think that the steelworkers are entitled to a raise, because the price of living is skyrocketing."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evelyn Brooks wearing eyeglasses, necklace, and light colored ribbed sweater, standing in front of C. C. Mellor Co., Smithfield Street, Downtown
